H0.text: Quantum numbers are the same sets of four that the first two electrons in lithium, which occupy the 1s orbital, have as the two electrons in helium.

H1.text: Decay numbers are the same sets of four numbers that the first two electrons in lithium fill the 1s orbital with as the two electrons in helium.

H2.text: Gravity numbers are the same sets of four that the first two electrons in lithium, which fill the 1s orbital, possess as the two electrons in helium.

H3.text: Kinetic numbers are the sets of four that the first two electrons in lithium, which fill the 1s orbital, share with the two electrons in helium.

A4.text: no two electrons in the same atom can have the same values of the four quantum numbers

A5.text: An orbital can be occupied by a maximum of two electrons, each with its own projection of spin ms.

A6.text: the ground state of Li is 1s22s.

A7.text: The K shell fills in the first period (hydrogen and helium), while the L shell fills in the second (lithium to neon).

A8.text: Each s subshell holds at most 2 electrons.

A9.text: The Pauli principle requires the distribution of these electrons within the atomic orbitals such that no more than two electrons are assigned to any one orbital; this requirement profoundly affects the atomic properties and ultimately the bonding of atoms into molecules.

A11.text: Helium has two electrons in its outermost shell
